name: Stream of Lives
description: A nightly broadcast of gladiatorial combat by slaves originates from a planet when Kirk was once held captive by twentieth century Romans. Shut down this brutal bloodsport and capture the slavers before they escape!
rules:
— There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
— In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
— Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
— Using any version of Navaar, Kirk, Ikat'ika, or crew with the Prisoner trait will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
— Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
— Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
— In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Navaar, Kirk, Ikat'ika, or Prisoners
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

adventures.name: A Thousand Tongues
adventures.description: Interrogate Navaar's partners about her hiding places.

adventures.name: Know Yourself
adventures.description: Protect your thoughts from Orion influence.

rewards.name: Stream of Lives
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "If you haven't been informed about these recent broadcasts yet, consider yourself lucky. Once a day, someone transmits a bloody gladiatorial arena fight across the entire quadrant. It seems to get more popular with each battle."

"When I watched one, it felt strangely familiar. On a hunch I tracked the signal's origin to the fourth planet of star system eight-nine-two. You see, I've been there before and had to watch as my crew fought Romans for the entertainment of others."

"Last time my loyalty to the Prime Directive stopped me from interfering with the planet's culture. Now they've brought Klingons and those Dominion creatures to fight to the death. We must put it to an end.

"Oh, dear Kirk, my little show isn't going anywhere. Our audience numbers just keep growing bigger, and that's bringing in buckets of latinum. You can't blame me for giving the people what they crave."
"You've done a fine job ending that broadcast and shutting down the arenas. Watching all those slaves go free, even the Klingons, makes the risk worth it."

responses.text: "She can't hide for long, the whole quadrant is looking for her."
"Why doesn't Starfleet shut down the Orion slave trade entirely?"
"Are you sure you don't just enjoy chasing green women?"

screens.text: "I can't help but feel some regret that we failed to capture that Orion ringleader. There's nothing in the galaxy that could make me comprehend enslaving another being. Let's hope we find her before she builds yet another arena."
"You make an excellent point. Between us, the Klingons, and the Dominion, she won't disappear for long. From what I hear of those other two, she better hope we find her first."
"Trust me, they've tried. Such an appalling practice deserves our full attention. But the Orions are practiced deceivers and seem to slip through our grasp every time."
"I'll never understand how I developed this undeserved reputation. Surely you're not suggesting I'd be interested in a slaver?"

"If you believe yourselves up to the challenge of finding this hated slavemaster Navaar, I have an idea. She was capturing Jem'Hadar before destroying their ships. We can scan energy signatures she left behind, and hunt her using that data. Together, this will go faster."
